intro: Phoradendron subfalcatum, commonly known as the Brazilian coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, cascading clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found growing as an epiphyte on trees in the understory of rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in tropical and subtropical gardens.
